name: (C) ESTAR HP Pt. FS (RTU, Other Fossil Heat)
_description: ENERGY STAR air source heat pump (w/ cold climates specs as applicable) w/ original distillate RTU backup
backup_fuel_fraction: 2023.2 Heat Pump RTU with Original Fuel Backup

notes: ENERGY STAR V. 4.0 went into effect in January 2023 as reflected under 2023 column. Ventilation savings are based on ComStock simulations of a variable speed HP RTU with energy recovery
savings are averaged across all states.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

installed_cost_source.notes: ENERGY STAR costs in 2023 normalized by capacity.

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

source_data.title: Updated Buildings Sector Appliance and Equipment Costs and Efficiencies
source_data.author: U.S. Energy Information Administration

notes: Heating multiple of 79% was determined by dividing square feet in which main heating equipment is oil or propane packaged unit (961852 sf) by square feet in which main heating equipment is oil or propane furnace or packaged unit (4543002 sf)

cooling multiple of 6% was determined by dividing square feet in which cooling equipment is packaged AND heating equipment is fossil other than natural gas (23161652 sf) by square feet with same cooling constraint and heating across all fuel types (357885079 sf). Ventilation multiples determined by square feet in which given ventilation system (VAV or CAV) is paired with given heating system for the measure.
